website_summaries.verdict: Tough boots that are comfortable out of the box.
pros: These boots are true to size and offer an extra-wide fit
They don't need to be broken in and provide great traction
Water-resistant leather uppers and Gore-Tex lining
cons: Some customers reported that their boots didn't last beyond a few hunded miles

customer_reviews.title: Future buyers pay attention to other negative GTX reviews ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: Future customers beware: please read negative reports on other Fugutive GTX reviews here with Amazon. Rubber soles and nose guard are of inferior material and Asolo's service is far below standard. The reputation of this European brand is down the drain for what I think of it and as it seems they don't care.
customer_reviews.author: eric-c

customer_reviews.title: Please Pay Attention to reviews and service warranty
customer_reviews.text: Poor customer service. Boots made of inferior materials. Within months laces wore and frayed, rubber soles worn completely down. Also boot eyelet fell out of boot. Was not offered repair or replace option. I am an avid hiker and veteran who is disappointed with the product and customer service. No repair shops available and was brushed aside by support.
customer_reviews.author: Reutger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Asolo's...
customer_reviews.text: These are really great, sturdy, and reliable boots that will offer little visible wear evidence even after many years of hard abuse. I have a pair of Asolo's, very similar to this one, that lasted through 2 two tours in Afghanistan (Naval Special Warfare), and 6 more years at home in the States, and are still going strong. Got these because I like the black, grey, red color scheme. These boots will probably outlast me. Beware, they are very stiff, and the sole insert is not very comfortable. Purchase a good aftermarket pair of sole inserts, and these will be the best boots you've owned in a long time guaranteed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart within a month
customer_reviews.text: I'm still waiting to heat back from this seller about a warranty or something to address this problem, but I'm pretty disappointed with these boots. Less than a month after purchasing them and moderate wear, the stitching on seam on the inner left boot started to become frayed and undone. This damage allows dirt, gravel and other debris to enter the boot, which makes wearing the boot become quite uncomfortable. This damage also reduces the "waterproofness" of the boots. It looks like several other reviewers have had issues with quality, and given the potential lack of warranty on these boots, I recommend other buyers to not risk paying nearly $250 for a potentially defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Perez

customer_reviews.title: Laces OUT!
customer_reviews.text: The boots were delivered 1/22/19. I wore them immediately and almost every day since. Fit is great, which is the primary focus. The style is also as advertised and great. The current and only concern is the metal eyelets and how they are tearing up the laces. Within two weeks, I saw the fraying and preemptively ordered a set from a company who utilize Kevlar. So far, love the fit and style. Hopefully the issues do not extend past the laces.
customer_reviews.author: S. Epps

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd pair in 17 years - love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These are the best fitting and most comfortable boots I've ever owned. I just bought my 3rd pair in about 17 years and as near as I can tell it is identical to the first pair. The uppers hold up very well. Eventually the soles wear thin and the rubber breaks down. I love these boots and will continue buying them as long as they are available when the old ones wear out. One thing I will say is that these boots are not waterproof. I was hiking out in Washington state last year in spring thru slushy snow and over the course of about six hours my feet got wet as the wet snow penetrated the leather uppers.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. The fit and design is perfect. Great ankle support, great closure, comfortable with good arch support, and well made. My last pair of Asolo boots was also goretex and they lasted me 13 years with casual use.
customer_reviews.author: Tysonius Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great! The only downside is they are more expensive than others. I've yet to find a shoe or boot with good arch support from the factory, so if you're like me add some Sole, Spenco, or Superfeet in these to make them the ultimate mid hiking boot. I've come across several people who had questions about the durability. Seems some had issues with the heel wearing fast. That hasn't been my experience. Using these in slot canyons has produced some extra wear but that's to be expected. Always try boots on with the socks you'll wear before you buy, but definitely give these a look.
customer_reviews.author: REV

customer_reviews.title: 4th Pair of great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these for years. I measure men’s 11-1/2 D US. I was happy to find a pair in that size that were black. Unfortunately, they were too small and the 12 didn’t come in black. Since I wore the 11-1/2 for about a month (hoping they’d stretch a bit), I didn’t think it was right to try to return them. In the end, I bought another pair and gave the others away. If you measure 11-1/2 D US, get a 12.
customer_reviews.author: NetBoss

customer_reviews.title: Quality expected
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding dual purpose boots for hiking without load and with moderate load on all terrain. Go straight out of the box with no break in. This is not my first pair of Asolos and these meet every expectation. Hint: Crosstie the first two loops instead of one after the other. It will make a better ankle support and easier tying along with hiding lace taughtness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight hiking boot!
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight hiking boot. Asolo boots run a tiny bit narrow, but many come in wide versions if needed. These boots (regular width) fit me perfectly. For their light weight, these boots are somewhat stiff (which is what I was looking for) and offer good ankle support. They are definitely water proof and very comfortable. I expect that these will last a long, long time based on my previous experience with Asolo boots.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: TWO AND A HALF STARS...but i will err on the more positive side. so i didnt really get to test these boots out because they were too narrow even in the wide version. Its unfortunate because they look cool and they are pretty light weight. i really really wanted these to fit but i just couldn't make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: comfy, waterproof,nice colors
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these boots for years because they are super comfy, very waterproof, breathable and they aren't the weird pink, turquoise or purple colors that a lot of lightweight hikers are.
customer_reviews.author: William Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: glad i bought this pair; the fit is excellent (i always swap out the arch supports for something after-market so i can't say squat about the default insoles it came with); the style is great and i appreciate who easy it is to lace up.
customer_reviews.author: Abraxas

customer_reviews.title: these are not nearly as comfortable as the old pair
customer_reviews.text: I'm replacing a very similar pair of Asolo boots. Frankly, these are not nearly as comfortable as the old pair. The foot bed is much more firm. I know you're thinking, yea the old pair was broken in and all comfy. I'm hoping these get that way too in time. But I don't think this is a break in kind of issue. I just think they are using less expensive materials.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Miles

customer_reviews.title: These Are The Boots You’re Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, rugged, good looking, functional. Everything I’d hoped for. I know that some of our Special Forces wear these same boots in Afghanistan and Iraq so I knew they’d be tough, but they’re even better than I’d hoped!
customer_reviews.author: Nationals Fan

customer_reviews.title: Gambled and got lucky
customer_reviews.text: Well I really gambled when I went on a 15 mile overnight backpacking trip after buying these and never wearing these prior to break them in. I am happy to report that they never failed me once throughout the hike. During the hottest point of the day we were hiking in 90-95 degree weather and still no blisters or sore feet. Great investment for your hiking adventures.
customer_reviews.author: rickrun

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you try these on with hiking socks.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots - I have used them for years. This is my third pair. I switched to a 12 wide for my third pair - which fits even better. I have used many brands over the years, this has been the best so far. As with anything, you get what you pay for. I would suggest using liner socks
customer_reviews.author: meteu399

customer_reviews.title: asolo quality?
customer_reviews.text: There was no problem with the vendor and product arrived before expected. Boots replace Asolos that are 10 yr old and wore out from hiking miles and trail maintenance work. New boots are comfortable and appear well made but very poor waterproofing, the 10 year old boots perform better!
customer_reviews.author: tski54

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe that broke in well, but deteriorated quickly
customer_reviews.text: Broke boots in then took them on a climb. After a day there was significant deterioration to the sole. I doubt they would hold up to moderate climbs. Go with a more advanced boot for a little more money and you'll be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Doug D.

customer_reviews.title: Quality boots!
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been wearing these types of hiking boots as I am a Pest Control specialist. I started with Merrill boots, then keens, then oboz. None of them lasted more than 6 months and they either ripped or the tread wore off. These boots are built with quality in mind. They take a couple of days to break in, but then they're amazing! I highly recommend them for comfort and ability to stay waterproof. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fugitives will make you a fan
customer_reviews.text: Second pair. I love these boots. I do a lot of hiking and I have never had any issues with these Asolos. I replaced them because the soles were starting to wear out. I will likely buy a third pair down the road. Update: These boots have served me well hiking the Tour Du Mont Blanc, Iceland and Patagonia, Chile. Love them
customer_reviews.author: H. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for Operators
customer_reviews.text: My Special Operations brothers wear these. Love these boots. Bought them to wear for hunting while I got my Kennatrex rebuild.... Love these so much, I haven’t sent the other boots to be rebuilt.
customer_reviews.author: Jager

customer_reviews.title: Not the same.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of asalo that have disappointed me for fit. I’ve had numerous asolo boots. My last pair were the Shiraz. They were outstanding. Perhaps they have set my expectations too high. Looking to get those again or get scarpa,s. Also good boots.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made!!
customer_reviews.text: Wore for 1 month and fell apart. Unfortunately for me they will not take return or exchange after 30 days! This shoe should NOT fall apart after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T. Amey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are my new go to shoes after replacing laces with 550 cord. The MARSOC guys i worked with had introduced me to them in Afghanistan; my Acadia boots would last 6 months before starting to fail. The Asolo boots have far exceeded them; from yrs in Afghanistan's deserts/ mountains/ muddy grape and poppy fields to hiking Fox glacier in New Zealand through Germany, Poland, Austria, Hungary, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Netherlands, Scotland, Ireland, Dubai and back to Afghanistan all one 1 pr of Asolo boots. I now have a new pair thinking about buying another pair for work.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyMoore

customer_reviews.title: These boots are comfortable enough for use right out of the box. I did not require any kind of break-in period.
customer_reviews.text: The size is exactly what it should be. I ordered these boots for winter and summer use, depending on what socks I wear. I have been promoting these boots to my buddies that are struggling with cold feet, even though they are not winter boots.
customer_reviews.author: handyhusband

customer_reviews.title: Asolo are best
customer_reviews.text: My favorite boot brand. Bought a pair over 20 years ago and they held up great, very well-made, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: David TX

customer_reviews.title: Still made in Europe
customer_reviews.text: Fits well out of the box. Had no break in issues. Use for work where I walk 3 to 5 miles in a day, outdoors, in all weather conditions. Too pricy for work but the support, physical protection and waterproof construction are worth it. Is a sturdy, well made boot and If the soles last more than a year it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: cricket 4103

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Overall out of the box this boot fit perfectly. As expected there is a short break in period. I did find these to be a little slick on wet rocks but that is really the issues I have had ( i mean it was raining what would you expect) we are going to really put these to the test once Mt Fuji opens for the season.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne N. Fierros

customer_reviews.title: Best boots..... Period
customer_reviews.text: I have been hiking all my life and I have never found a better boot then these.... They wear crampons well, style in snow shoes and are great when climbing slab. My one and only regret is that they don't last for ever and they can not be repair.... They are a high tech master piece and will give you a good year or two.... To enjoy.... But the heel and ball of your foot will start feeling the slipping feeling when they are done....magic as far as I can say... Hike all over... Moab, Colorado, New Mexico, Argentina, Antactica .... These boots are the real deal
customer_reviews.author: Vermont802

customer_reviews.title: GREAT boot. Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Although NARROW, this boot is the best of the best in the price category. I wear a normal width in every shoe and boot, but a WIDE in this boot, and it’s still a little snug but good for hiking. The soles are not squishy, but firm and supportive. The soles are also stiff enough so that your feet aren’t abused by rock gravel and roots on multi day hikes
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great look good fit but stiff though should loosen up.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful boot. Ive received many compliments and questions about this boot. Fit perfect right out of the box. It's a stiff boot that'll hopefully break in quickly. Not a lot of cushion on insole. I put a gel heel insert to help with that.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence E Dodd

customer_reviews.title: It Asolo
customer_reviews.text: It's Asolo. What more needs to be said. These boots will last years under the harshest of conditions. From trail hiking to the mountains of Afghanistan.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Held up really well!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t really have time to break them in before my hunting trip this year, and we all know the cardinal rule about doing that...well they were better than expected and needed no real break in time. No rubbing, no hot spots, no pinching over a week long trip. Recommend these all the way, paired up with Merino wool socks!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Giammarino

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to break boots in. Not very comfortable and foot bed is really uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: Slp

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: This new pair is replacing a pair I bought 12-13 years ago. The old pair I wore all winter long and on many hikes in the summer. They held up wonderfully until I literally wore out the soles. Keep my feet dry and warm. I'm happy that Asolo still makes them. Made ordering the exact same ones again an easy choice. I hope the new ones last as long, they seem to be just as good quality.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: No competition
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots I've ever worn. This is my third pair. I've tried Scarpas and Keenes, but I keep coming back to these. Nothing else I've tried in this price range competes.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Asolo Fugitive GTX Black
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, arrived on time, and good fit! I'm always between a 10 & 10.5 men's standard. I went with 10.5 here and probably should've gone with a 10 but everything's fine with thicker socks. It's just that one foot is a little loose when wearing thin socks. Awesome looking boots though!
customer_reviews.author: bWillum

customer_reviews.title: This is my husbands second pair the first he work ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my husbands second pair the first he work most days for 6 years before they were no longer supportive for hiking. He still wears those when doing work around the house but got him this new pair for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Kymberlee Royals

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are the best, most comfortable boots I have ever owned. This is my third pair, and they are worth every penny. They last forever, are thoroughly waterproof, and are just insanely comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: good sturdy boot
customer_reviews.text: have bought this brand before. good sturdy boot. use them for long term hiking and survival courses. last pair lasted two years of hard use. these may take a little time time to break in as usual for most boots. good socks a must.stay away from cotton, use merioal wool boot socks.
customer_reviews.author: cowboy tack

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations for comfort. My daily wear boots. They look even better all dusty from mountain work.
customer_reviews.author: em

customer_reviews.title: Fits great right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Fits exactly as described with excellent support. I have been wearing these for two weeks in the rain and mud and they feel great with a aggressive sole
customer_reviews.author: andrew Marquez

customer_reviews.title: The best by far
customer_reviews.text: I believe Apolo makes the very best boot. I wore out one pair on the Appalachian trail. Now I have a winter pair and a summer pair. I enthusiastically recommend them. My girl friend had two pairs of boots and did not really like either one. I gave her a pair of Asolo'so and now she wears them everywhere. It does not get better than Asolo.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Fe Horses

customer_reviews.title: The last pair of boots you will ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are form fitting, warm waterproof extremely rugged. The non slip sole makes them great for biking. Best boot i ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Review for fit only, haven't worn them extensively yet. I wear a 9.5 wide in most boots. Bought a 10D in these and it fit great. The length exactly matched a pair of similar construction (GTX/leather/Cordura) 10EE Danners I own. The width was perfect - snug but not tight at all with midweight wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots - bought wrong size
customer_reviews.text: This would have been my second pair. Unfortunately I was unable to read the size tag inside my original pair to determine if they were medium or wide sized 10.5 US. So, I bought the wide ones and immediately returned them as they were too wide. BUT GREAT BOOTS, people!
customer_reviews.author: 'Jack'

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color wrong heel color
customer_reviews.text: Love the boots but you guys set me the wrong color the heal is supposed to be red not black
customer_reviews.author: Jaytee davis

customer_reviews.title: Fit Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box boots fit and feel like they're already broken in. Best fit I've ever had in a hiking boot. One of few brands that offers extra wide. Successfully passed waterproof test. Just started wearing so can't vouch for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Really love these boots. I finally bought these after doing a lot of research and they hold up to their name. I seemed to break them in after only 5-10 miles on them and they were never uncomfortable or tight they just feel better now after about 10 miles on them. I sprayed them but overall it is great quality and I like the color scheme.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Colin Searcy

customer_reviews.title: So good I’m on my second pair.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I had to stay with what was a perfect boot. I do heavy work and these have been amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great all around boot.
customer_reviews.text: As a large nurse on my feet 12+ hour shifts these are the only way to go. Been wearing them for years without issue. They outlast any other option I've tried. As a bonus they don't make clunky noises walking in the hall. I have a pair for the shop, one for work, and pair for the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Billie1

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: My husband's previous pair of Asolo's were so worn, the sole finally came off when his boot got stuck in the mud...a fitting end to a great pair of hiking boots. Of course he wanted another pair of the same brand. These fit perfectly and he also loves the red detailing.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these boots.
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of these since 2007. The only reason I bought the second pair is that I wore out the soles and the rubberized toe guard material was detaching from the leather (simple fix). LOVE these boots.
customer_reviews.author: 'Jack'

customer_reviews.title: ... I have purchased over the years has felt as comfortable as the worn out boots I'm replacing
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of Asolo hiking boots and every new pair I have purchased over the years has felt as comfortable as the worn out boots I'm replacing. The size remains constant from pair to pair and the quality is superior to other boots I've had. They hold up really well under rugged conditions and they also clean up well. I couldn't be happier with Asolo hiking boots and I highly recommend them. Happy trails! Boone in Saint Helena, CA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed boot
customer_reviews.text: I like them but the boots are narrower than normal needed a wide , good quality
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Link

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff takes 2 months to break in. Last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie74

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my father (60 years young) for an upcoming hiking trip. He started wearing them to work to break them in and after just 2 days he started noticing his knee pain going away. These are great quality and extremely comfortable! I would recommend them for anyone looking for some hiking boots when ever they ware out I will be getting more.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great Durable Hunting Boot
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of hiking boots! I wear these on a construction crew and they hold up very well. Would recommend to anybody. Wouldn't be scared to use these on a backcountry hunt.
customer_reviews.author: Keith and Bonnie Ensz

customer_reviews.title: They are really comfortable from day one
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots! Keep your feet warm, he wore them in Afghanistan, so when he came home we had to get a new pair. They are really comfortable from day one!
customer_reviews.author: WJH

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials and construction.
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials and construction. Not too heavy. Fits my narrow foot well. Laces are quick to lace up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Took several days to break in. Now a great, comfortable pair of hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kramarczyk

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I hiked over 500 miles on the first. The first held up well, around the 450 mile mark they weren’t water tight anymore, and the sole and the tread started to separate. But with that many miles of rigorous through hikes, that’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW C.

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots. Comfortable and functional.
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable. Hiked 10 miles with a pack, without breaking them in, and had no hot spots or blisters. The heel cup fits great and keeps your foot aligned. The top provides good ankle support without being too stiff. The outsole is solid and has great traction. The lacing allows you to leave room in the foot while keeping the ankle tight to prevent rolled ankles. I went from an all-leather Asolo boot to these and am even happier with these than I was with my old Asolos (which were a great pair of boots).
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic hiking shoes. I purchased them to hike the Inca Trail from Cuzco to Macchu Picchu and they are extremely comfortable and have superior grip to other hiking shoes. I can stand at a 45 degree angle on a wet, rock surface and be confident that I'm not going to slip in these.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I love my boots. After a short break in period these boots feel great. I wore them all summer and winter. I have not done much hiking yet but I am sure they will be champs when I hit the mountains this summer
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots, light and sturdy. The previous ones I owned lasted for years. Soles are a little hard for my liking so had to buy a padded insert for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair 2 years ago and still going stron. Bought this recent pair to wear for work!! As expected!! Asolo never disappoints!! Using this product for work. LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THEM! I'll update if anything fails.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, overall!
customer_reviews.text: All in all a quite comfortable boot. Have some unusual rubbing between big toe, but may just need breking in. Not as comfortable as my Salewa's, but great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reinders II

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is buy the boots. You can't go wrong with asolos
customer_reviews.text: I use shoes for work. Im a construction worker im on my feet all day. I do alot of walking and when not walking im climbing around in ceilings. Balancing on what ever I can to get job done. These boots are a bad ass boot and love how good they breathe. They are great summer boots.
customer_reviews.author: M chappell

customer_reviews.title: Boots are comfortable, fit good
customer_reviews.text: Boots are comfortable, fit good, but I am not satisfied with the quality, especially with waterproofness. After 3 times of use, I walked in wet grass for 2 hours and my feet were 100% wet.
customer_reviews.author: Ashot Arushanyan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boots EVER! My third pair, in 12 years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High speed, low drag
customer_reviews.text: So far, these are the most comfortable, rugged, and light weight boots I've owned to date. Have worn boots year-round for daily construction career, weekend hunting and fishing, and ski trips out west for about 15 years now. I read a number of write-ups and reviews by special forces / operators that swear by these things, and all I can say is that these are definitely "high speed, low drag"!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... hours a day & said these are the most comfortable boots he has worn
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on his feet 12 hours a day & said these are the most comfortable boots he has worn.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: GREAT boots
customer_reviews.text: GREAT shoes. This is pair number 2 purchased. They easily go from hiking to work boots and take a beating without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sarabeth

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot, I will get about 6 months in ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot,I will get about 6 months in construction out of these,long hours on them
customer_reviews.author: Brad A. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Sweet fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second pair, I had a hard time finding hikers that fit well enough to survive a 10 hr. day on the trail without some issue. These are perfect for me. No looking back.
customer_reviews.author: chuck sim

customer_reviews.title: This is my third pair in 5 years I love them they have not let me down backpacking in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair in 5 years I love them they have not let me down backpacking in all kinds of terrain in the USA and the UK.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very True To Size
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn them a couple of hours so this is about fit only. I know every 8 1/2D foot is different but for my foot this is the best, truest 8 1/2D I have encountered in a long. long time. I hope the rest of the experience goes as well. I think I'm really going to like this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Snodoc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite boots as far as comfort goes, after 1 year, they do show some wear.
customer_reviews.author: Austin J  Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect comfort out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and comfort. Out of the box I wore these boots on a 3 days Mountain search and rescue operation near Yosemite National Park!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Huey

customer_reviews.title: awesome boot!
customer_reviews.text: awesome boot!!! cost a little more, but that is to be expected with superior brand. fits like a glove...or a boot :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mon

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hiking boots. They broke in quickly and are extremely comfortable. They handle rugged terrain and keep your feet dry. I recommend wearing wool socks personally, and even with my thicker wool these still fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: zgreenw

customer_reviews.title: Asolo shoes
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for any mountain climbing or the professional working down range
customer_reviews.author: Fireman_mando

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the boot
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears Asolo boots all the time. I got these for him because he likes the sage color. They were just what he expected and just what he likes. They are very durable and give good support. He is on his feet all the time and they work well for him. He is very hard on his shoes, and these boots hold up well. He has several pair of this style of Asolo boot.
customer_reviews.author: A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great for any sort of hiking or walking on surfaces with less than ideal traction. Comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: N. Eppler

customer_reviews.title: Not so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not what i was expected they came with demaged shoe laces
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very Comfortable and Sturdy. Excellent for Long hikes and climbing and comfortable enough to use for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Casler

customer_reviews.title: If you wear a men’s 7.5 order a 7.
customer_reviews.text: If you wear a 7.5 men’s order a half size down. This boot does not fit like the rest of Asolos boots. It runs a large.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Ton

customer_reviews.title: but they are so comfortable. Rough concerte is bad for the soles and ...
customer_reviews.text: On my forth pair!!! Trash em at work, but they are so comfortable. Rough concerte is bad for the soles and rebar pokes holes in the gor-Tex. I know they are not made for that. Hope they don’t change the design.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots for constant use
customer_reviews.text: I wear hiking boots all day almost every day. I've been buying these Asolo boots for more than a decade. They last about 2 years of continuous use and many hundreds of miles of hiking. Great ankle and arch support. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Timm Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box. Very well built quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Eh!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hiking boot! I've tried a lot of different pairs of boots and by far the best yet . Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Petty

customer_reviews.title: ... the money you get what you pay for very nice!
customer_reviews.text: For the money you get what you pay for very nice !
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, extremely durable.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable, and they are made out of high quality materials. I love wearing mine and would highly recommend them for others to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis Bodenmiller

customer_reviews.title: My first review was 5 stars for the great comfort and support
customer_reviews.text: My first review was 5 stars for the great comfort and support, but I have had these less than a year and the soles are wearing extremely quickly. I log about 20 miles a week, and at this rate I don't think they will last 3 years. I am accustomed to getting more years than this from my hiking boots, and I don't think that I will be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Stitches come unraveled
customer_reviews.text: I've always bought this boot but this pair has came undone on me. I hoping to exchange them for a new pair. But im afraid that thats only a REI thing
customer_reviews.author: Amaz Custome

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality control excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The brand is like a Lamborghini or Ferrari on the street a Ducati on the track ....... it’s like ASOLO is the GUCCI of the outdoor. 😎
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and feel but still new
customer_reviews.text: Great so far only one weekend in and about 10 miles down but felt great the whole time. I will give it four stars if they last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Cascadia

product_meta.title: Asolo Men's Fugitive GTX Hiking Boot
feature_bullets: The meaning of "V", "GV" and "GTX" in the Asolo style names: V stands for a Vibram outsole, GV stands for Gore-Tex lining with a Vibram outsole, and GTX is for a GORE-TEX® lining.
Ideal choice for light hikers and trekkers who demand lightweight and comfort with a snappy design.

Duo Asoflex midsole in which two elements are melted together to improve comfort and performance. The first element, constructed of a stiff material benefits anti pronation, anti supination and anti torsion. The second element, constructed with a softer material offers shock absorption while walking.
Water resistant suede and Cordura® uppers.

GORE-TEX® liners for waterproof yet breathable boots. Outsole is a combination of bi-density rubber bottom for cushion and traction. Shoe weighs 1.52lbs (690gr). You may also like this Camelbak Rim Runner™ 2010 bag Measurements: Weight: 1 lb 10 oz Shaft: 5 3⁄4 in Product measurements were taken using size US Men's 10, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
